main

Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the logic of the game used to update information during the rounds. This is able to track the movement of objects that are on the screen. Also, this is where the Towers check to see if they are in range to shoot at the enemies on the game board.
    Author:
    Ryan Barbera, Aaron George, Nick Norton, Thomas Pennington, Grant Zhao

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameModel()
      Creates an GameModel object and instantiates arrayLists that will keep track of enemies and towers when the are needed in the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameModel

        public GameModel()
        Creates an GameModel object and instantiates arrayLists that will keep track of enemies and towers when the are needed in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • isReloading

        public boolean isReloading(int towerInd)
        Checks to see if the tower in the arrayList is reloading when firing at an enemy on the game board. It will reduce the reload count by 1 if it has not reached zero at which point it is able to fire at the enemy when it gets to zero.
        Parameters:
        towerInd - the index of the tower to check the reload count from
        Returns:
        true if the reload count is 0 for firing or false to reduce the reload count by 1

      • resetReload

        public void resetReload(int towerInd)
        Resets the reload time of the tower that is in the tower arrayList.
        Parameters:
        towerInd - the index of the Tower that you want to reset the reload time for

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(int towerInd,
                         EnemyModel em)
        Checks the range of the tower versus the enemy, if it is range it returns true If it is not in range it returns false. This will determine if an enemy is able to shoot towards the enemy during the game.
        Parameters:
        towerInd - the tower that you need to get the positions from
        em - the enemyModel that you need to get the position from
        Returns:
        true if the Tower is in range of the of the enemy or false if the Tower is not in the range of the enemy

      • damageEnemy

        public boolean damageEnemy(int towerInd,
                           EnemyModel em)
        Adds damage to the current object that is on the game given a Tower index from the arrayList of Towers and an EnemyModel.
        Parameters:
        towerInd - the index of the tower in the arrayList to access the total damage that Tower has
        em - the enemyModel that you need to get the current health of
        Returns:
        true if the current health is 0 or false if the health is not equal to 0

      • moveEnemy

        public void moveEnemy(EnemyModel enemyUnit)
        Moves the enemy at the given index in this game's enemyList toward the next destination in the path, And, if the enemy reaches the destination, returns true if the enemy falls out of bounds, And returns false, while updating its direction, if it does not
        Parameters:
        enemyUnit - an EnemyModel that is able to be spawned in the game

      • isOutOfBounds

        public boolean isOutOfBounds(EnemyModel enemyUnit)
        Gets the position index of an EnemyModel and returns true if the enemy at the given index in this game's enemyList has reached the end of the path, or returns false otherwise
        Parameters:
        enemyUnit - an enemy unit that is able to be spawned
        Returns:
        true if the enemy is out of bounds or false value if the enemy is not out of bounds

      • spawnEnemy

        public EnemyModel spawnEnemy()
        Randomly spawns an enemy and places the enemy at the top opening of the path. Then it is added into the arrayList of enemies and returns the EnemyModel that it created.
        Returns:
        an EmemyModel that was spawned randomly

      • reducePlayerHealth

        public void reducePlayerHealth(int i)
        Reduces the players health when an enemy makes it out of the Estuary by making it to the end of the path. The view will be updated accordingly when this takes place in the game.
        Parameters:
        i - an integer that reduces the players health

      • reducePlayerMoney

        public void reducePlayerMoney(int i)
        Reduces the players money when a Tower is purchased in the game. This will be updated in the view when the player's money goes down.
        Parameters:
        i - an integer that will decrease the players money by set amount

      • increasePlayerMoney

        public void increasePlayerMoney(int i)
        Increases the players money by a given amount during game play when the Towers are attacking the enemies. The view will be updated by this change when there is an increase in the player's money.
        Parameters:
        i - an integer that increases the players money

      • gainBounty

        public void gainBounty(int enemyInd)
        Increases the player's money by the enemy bounty when an enemy is killed by the Tower. The view will be updated to reflect this change.
        Parameters:
        enemyInd - the index of the enemy list to access the bounty of a particular enemy

      • isPlayerDead

        public boolean isPlayerDead()
        Checks to see if the player is dead when enemies get past the estuary at the end of the path. If the players health is above 0 then it returns false and true if the health is 0.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the players health has reached 0

      • increaseScore

        public void increaseScore(int inc)
        Increases the players score when Tower attacks an enemy on the game board. The players score will be updated in the view accordingly when the score increases.
        Parameters:
        inc - the amount that the score increases

      • getPath

        public PathModel getPath()

      • getFactory

        public Factory getFactory()

      • getPlayer

        public PlayerModel getPlayer()

      • getIndexedTowerModel

        public TowerModel getIndexedTowerModel(int towerIndex)
        Returns the tower model given an index to locate a particular tower that has been created.
        Parameters:
        towerIndex - the index of the Tower that is needed from the arrayList
        Returns:
        the tower model at the specific index that is requested.

      • getTowerList

        public java.util.ArrayList<TowerModel> getTowerList()

      • getEnemyList

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnemyModel> getEnemyList()
